page.title: 02Whiteley Village-History
page.content: {William Whiteley}was born in 1831 in the north of England. He opened a shop in London, and as he made more money this grew to become a large department store. He arranged in his will for part of his fortune to be used to build a village of small houses for his retired workers. In 1907 he was shot dead by his son, and soon after this date the building of the village began. The first World War brought a halt to building, and the village was officially opened by King George V and Queen Mary on May 28th 1921. They used a "golden" key, which is displayed, with photographs and newspaper cuttings in the clubhouse.They planted two trees outside the main church, opposite the hospital.These trees were PINUS CEMBRA.
